definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Tripping results in a 10-yard penalty against the offending team.
sentences.chinese: 絆人犯規犯規隊被判罰10碼開外的點球。

sentences.english: It crashed in the sea, a few yards from the shore.
sentences.chinese: 最終，它墜毀於離岸邊幾碼地開外的海里。

sentences.english: Tripping results in a 10-yard penalty against the offending team。
sentences.chinese: 絆人犯規導致犯規隊被判罰10碼開外的點球。

sentences.english: As people walked past, they cupped their hands over their noses and mouths because of the smell. A few feet away, young touts sold scratch cards for a mobile-phone company to passing motorists.
sentences.chinese: 幾步開外，還有年輕人在向路過的汽車出售手機卡。

sentences.english: Twenty yards away, he glanced back.
Bebeto volleyed the ball 30 metres away from the net.
sentences.chinese: 貝貝託在距球門30米開外凌空抽射。

sentences.english: This focusing power is equivalent to the ability to read a newspaper at a distance of half a mile.
sentences.chinese: 其強大聚焦功能，相當於半英里開外閱讀一份報紙。

sentences.english: A shore and a few marinas are a few hundred meters away.
sentences.chinese: 數百公里開外，是一處海濱和幾處小碼頭。

sentences.english: Hout Bay) is a beautiful place, 50 miles outside of Cape Town.
sentences.chinese: 豪特灣是個美麗的地方，位於開普敦50英里開外。

sentences.english: A woman more than a little of 40 was standing right behind the boy.
sentences.chinese: 一個四十開外的女人站在男孩正後方。
